description: The last part of three of The Divine Comedy, an epic poem written by Dante Alighieri between 1308 and his death in 1321. The poem is written in the first person, and tells of Dante's journey through the three realms of the dead, lasting from the night before Good Friday to the Wednesday after Easter in the spring of 1300. The Divine Comedy finishes with Vision of Paradise or Paradiso, in which Dante sees the Triune God. In a flash of understanding, which he cannot express, Dante finally understands the mystery of Christ's divinity and humanity, and his soul becomes aligned with God's love. To have access to this classic masterpiece download our ebook today!
